Class NamedBuilder<X>

java.lang.Object
io.github.ericmedvet.jnb.core.NamedBuilder<X>
Type Parameters:
X - the type of objects this builder can produce
public class NamedBuilder<X> extends Object

A factory that can build objects of type X (or a subtype) from a NamedParamMap. Internally, it holds a collection of Builder instances, each associated with a unique name. When build is called, it looks up the appropriate Builder based on the NamedParamMap name and uses it to construct the object.

A NamedBuilder is typically obtained from existing utility classes (through fromUtilityClass(Class)), normal classes (through fromClass(Class)), or from both, automatically discovered in packages in the current classpath (through fromDiscovery(String...)). Such classes need to be annotated with the proper annotations (Discoverable, BuilderMethod, Alias, Param).

  • Field Summary

    Modifier and Type

    static final char
    NAME_SEPARATOR
    The character used to separate parts of names in a hierarchical structure.
    static final char
    PREFIX_SEPARATOR
    The character used to separate prefixes synonyms, used by the Discoverable annotation.

      The character used to separate parts of names in a hierarchical structure.
      See Also:

  • Method Details

    • empty

      public static NamedBuilder<Object> empty()
      Returns an empty NamedBuilder that cannot build any object.
      Returns:
      an empty NamedBuilder

    • fromDiscovery

      public static NamedBuilder<Object> fromDiscovery(String... packageNames)
      Returns a NamedBuilder with builders obtained by discovery from classes annotated with @Discoverable within the specified packages (or everywhere if packageNames is empty). Internally, this method work by invoking fromClass(Class) or fromUtilityClass(Class) depending on the case.
      Parameters:
      packageNames - an array of package names to scan for discoverable classes
      Returns:
      a NamedBuilder populated with discovered builders

    • fromClass

      public static <C> NamedBuilder<C> fromClass(Class<? extends C> clazz)
      Creates a NamedBuilder from a given class. It expects the class to have exactly one public constructor, or exactly one public constructor annotated with @BuilderMethod. In that constructor, parameters (whose type is different of NamedParameter, which can appear at most once, as type) have to be annotated with Param. Internally, it invokes AutoBuiltDocumentedBuilder.from(java.lang.reflect.Executable, Alias[]).
      Type Parameters:
      C - the type of the class
      Parameters:
      clazz - the class from which to create the builder
      Returns:
      a NamedBuilder capable of building instances of C, whose name is the simple name of the class in lower camel case

    • fromUtilityClass

      public static NamedBuilder<Object> fromUtilityClass(Class<?> clazz)
      Creates a NamedBuilder from a given utility class. It discovers public static methods in the class and attempts to create builders from them: each public static method in the class will have a builder whose name is the one of the method.
      Parameters:
      clazz - the utility class from which to create the builder
      Returns:
      a NamedBuilder capable of building objects using the utility methods

    • prettyToString

      public static String prettyToString(NamedBuilder<?> namedBuilder, boolean newLine)
      Returns a pretty string representation of the NamedBuilder, listing all registered builders.
      Parameters:
      namedBuilder - the NamedBuilder to represent
      newLine - if true, each builder will be on a new line; otherwise, they will be separated by "; "
      Returns:
      a string representation of the NamedBuilder

    • and

      public NamedBuilder<X> and(String prefix, NamedBuilder<? extends X> otherNamedBuilder)
      Creates a new NamedBuilder by adding all builders from otherNamedBuilder under a given prefix. The returned NamedBuilder will have all the builders of this NamedBuilder, with their original name, and all the builders of otherNamedBuilder, with their name prefixed by prefix` followed by NAME_SEPARATOR.
      Parameters:
      prefix - the prefix to apply to the names of the added builders
      otherNamedBuilder - the NamedBuilder whose builders are to be added
      Returns:
      a new NamedBuilder with the combined builders

    • and

      public NamedBuilder<X> and(List<String> prefixes, NamedBuilder<? extends X> otherNamedBuilder)
      Creates a new NamedBuilder by adding all builders from otherNamedBuilder under a list of given prefixes. Every builder of otherNamedBuilder is added once for every prefix, with a name which is the original name prefixed by prefix followed by NAME_SEPARATOR.
      Parameters:
      prefixes - a list of prefixes to apply to the names of the added builders
      otherNamedBuilder - the NamedBuilder whose builders are to be added
      Returns:
      a new NamedBuilder with the combined builders

    • and

      public NamedBuilder<X> and(NamedBuilder<? extends X> otherNamedBuilder)
      Creates a new NamedBuilder by adding all builders from otherNamedBuilder without any prefix.
      Parameters:
      otherNamedBuilder - the NamedBuilder whose builders are to be added
      Returns:
      a new NamedBuilder with the combined builders

    • build

      public <T extends X> T build(NamedParamMap map, Supplier<T> defaultSupplier, int index) throws BuilderException
      Builds an object of type T (a subtype of X) from the provided NamedParamMap. If no builder is found for the map name, defaultSupplier is used if provided, otherwise a BuilderException is thrown. The index is available when building sequences and is expected to be set accordingly by the caller.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the specific type of object to build
      Parameters:
      map - the NamedParamMap containing the parameters for building the object
      defaultSupplier - a supplier for a default object, used if no builder is found
      index - the index of the object to build (different from 0 if the object is a part of sequence)
      Returns:
      the built object
      Throws:
      BuilderException - if there is no builder for the map name or the building fails and no default supplier is provided

    • build

      public <T extends X> T build(String mapString, Supplier<T> defaultSupplier) throws BuilderException
      Builds an object of type T (a subtype of X) from the provided mapString, which is parsed into a NamedParamMap using StringParser.parse(String). If no builder is found for the map name, defaultSupplier is used if provided, otherwise a BuilderException is thrown.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the specific type of object to build
      Parameters:
      mapString - the string representation of the NamedParamMap
      defaultSupplier - a supplier for a default object, used if no builder is found
      Returns:
      the built object
      Throws:
      BuilderException - if there is no builder for the map name or the building fails and no default supplier is provided

    • build

      public X build(NamedParamMap map) throws BuilderException
      Builds an object of type X using the provided NamedParamMap.
      Parameters:
      map - the NamedParamMap containing the parameters for building the object
      Returns:
      the built object
      Throws:
      BuilderException - if there is no builder for the map name or the building fails

    • build

      public X build(String mapString) throws BuilderException
      Builds an object of type T (a subtype of X) from the provided mapString, which is parsed into a NamedParamMap using StringParser.parse(String).
      Parameters:
      mapString - the string representation of the NamedParamMap
      Returns:
      the built object
      Throws:
      BuilderException - if there is no builder for the map name or the building fails

    • getBuilders

      public Map<String,Builder<? extends X>> getBuilders()
      Returns an unmodifiable map of the builders currently registered with this NamedBuilder.
      Returns:
      an unmodifiable map of builders

    • fillWithDefaults

      public NamedParamMap fillWithDefaults(NamedParamMap map)
      Fills the provided NamedParamMap with default values where parameters are missing, based on the builder, if any, associated with the map name in this NamedBuilder. Note that default values are present in builders of type DocumentedBuilder, not necessarily in any builder.
      Parameters:
      map - the NamedParamMap to fill with defaults
      Returns:
      a new NamedParamMap with default values applied
